section.section:
The Governor shall:
appoint the members with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate; and
consider demographic and geographic diversity when making appointments to the Commission.

text.section: Each member of the Commission shall be a citizen of the State.

section.section:
While a member of the Commission, a consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Commission; or
grade any examination given by or for the Commission.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Commission shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 3 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on January 1, 1991.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may not serve for more than 2 consecutive 3-year terms.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
